posts._title: Natasha Arthy – Se til venstre, der er en Svensker AKA Old, New, Borrowed and Blue (2003)
posts.title: Se til venstre, der er en Svensker
posts.excerpt: REVIEW by Anji Milanovic (from plume-noire.com):In Old, New, Borrowed and Blue director Natasha Arthy begins the film with a signed certificate of authenticity from the Dogma school. By the film’s end, however, it’s clear that she has taken the rules of Dogma and used them to make her own engaging film, instead of an exercise …

posts.title: My Scientology Movie
posts.excerpt: Louis documents his investigation into what goes on behind the scenes of the infamous church of scientology.

posts.title: Under the Shadow
posts.excerpt: As a mother and daughter struggle to cope with the terrors of the post-revolution, war-torn Tehran of the 1980s, a mysterious evil begins to haunt their home.Shideh (Narges Rashidi) and her family live amid the chaos of the Iran-Iraq war, a period known as The War of the Cities. posts.title: Those Love Pangs
posts.excerpt: Quote:Charlie and a rival vie for the favors of their landlady. In the park they each fall for different girls, though Charlie’s has a male friend already. Charlie considers suicide, is talked out of it by a policeman, and later throws his girl’s friend into the lake. Frightened, the girls go off to a movie. …

posts.title: Scream, Pretty Peggy
posts.excerpt: A sculptor hires young college girls to take care of his elderly mother and his supposedly insane sister, both of whom live in the old family mansion with him

posts._title: Aki Kaurismäki – Hamlet liikemaailmassa AKA Hamlet Goes Business (1987) (HD)
posts.title: Hamlet liikemaailmassa
posts.excerpt: Quote:A sardonic and irreverent contemporary adaptation of William Shakespeare’s Hamlet, Hamlet Goes Business is an idiosyncratically whimsical, yet incisive satire on corporate greed, materialism, corruption, and vengeance. Shot in black and white and employing high contrast lighting, the film achieves an atmospheric noir that reflects Aki Kaurismäki’s irrepressibly droll sense of humor and penchant for …

posts.title: Le Remords
posts.excerpt: SynopsisA filmmaker witnesses an act of racist police violence in Paris. He discusses with a lady whether and how he should make a film out of this. posts._title: Slobodan Sijan – Davitelj protiv davitelja AKA Strangler vs. Strangler (1985)
posts.title: Davitelj protiv davitelja
posts.excerpt: Quote:Belgrade, the capital of Serbia, only became a metropolis when it got its first serial killer. The said killer is a big, fat, shy and mother-fixated man, played to deadpan perfection by one of Serbia’s greatest comedians, Tasko Nacic. He lives with his cruel mother in a gothic apartment resembling those from Mario Bava’s films. …
